Do you hate yourself?  Do you hate your friends?  If not, do you want to?  Get Dead by Daylight the only asymmetric horror game that'll have your friends wondering "Wow I never knew I could ever hate someone this much."  Thanks Behaviour Interactive for showing a new way to feel absolute unyielding rage to complete utter strangers on the internet. A toxic cesspool of the worst people ever.  Also some of my greatest friends, if you too want to befriend those you absolutely positively despise with every fiber of your being.  TRY DEAD BY DAYLIGHT TODAY!
un buen juego que va en decadencia debido a su comunidad toxica y las malas decisiones de la desarrolladora

This game has had and still does have so much potential. I have been playing this game since I believe 2017 and it became my main addiction for the longest time. No game is perfect but as a log in each day and go through the rounds, its' flaws become more and more apparent. 

This game is severely unbalanced. It favors one side heavily and everyone knows it. The only people who I don't think knows this are the developers. It makes playing this game grueling and it went from being a fun time with a cool idea in a genre I really love to this feeling of dread and helplessness. 

The people I go against every day are incredibly toxic and childish. I have to deal with people ranging from 10 year old name calling to people using racial slurs. Then there's the group of people who group up as a team and go in with the sole mission of making the other side's game go as horrible as they can make it and try their best to make them angry knowing full well that it doesn't matter and the imbalance favors them no matter what.

As I feel these things, I look out to streamers and YouTuber's playing the game and I can see they feel the same way and I can take some solace in the fact that it isn't just me. 

I want this game to be good. I want to have fun in this game. But right now, it's just a promise that keeps letting me down. Maybe one day it could be in a good state but today is not that day.

Edit: As I'm looking at the reviews, I see this game as been "Very Positive" for recent reviews but all I can see is people saying all negative things about the game but recommending the game. I'm not sure but it seems like other people feel the way I feel when they think this game has potential but in it's current state it's just self torture.

In terms of sandbox horror survival games, there's a reason this one has survived longer than any of the other competitors.  From iconic killers and survivors to never know what is going to happen this game can go anyway and people can still have fun.  At least until you hit a certain rank where everyone becomes kind of toxic which is the case with every game these days so strap in and survive or get your rocks off while murdering some helpless survivors.  whatever you're feeling for the day

The game is very addictive, and can be fun playing with friends, but I just can't recommend it. Even after 100+ hours, I'm barely starting to break through the bloodpoint grind and unlock the meta perks that actually make the game feel competitive. One of the most fun parts of the game, coming up with build ideas, is locked behind literally dozens of hours of grinding. And even then, if you want to feel competitive and win matches, you'll often be stuck going back to the same perks over and over again anyway (if you have been lucky enough to unlock them). On the survivor side, playing solo is generally a terrible experience filled with teammates that don't play to objectives and ignore people outside of their voice chat. On the killer side, get ready to immediately play against high ranked survivors on voice comms kitted out with the best perks in the game because there aren't enough people willing to play killer at high ranks to match them with. The new matchmaking has somewhat alleviated this issue, but it's still not great. Everytime I've sat down and tried to boot this game up recently I just find myself feeling more frustrated than anything by the end of a few matches, and I question why I keep coming back to something that I don't find fun anymore. For now, uninstall.
